paraphrase_or_explanation:
Mice are very important in studying the brain. They are useful for scientists because they can control and study them easily. Scientists use mice to learn more about how the brain works. 

In the past, researchers usually chose to work with male mice instead of female mice. They did this because they were worried about hormones in female mice. Hormones are natural chemicals in the body that can affect how an animal behaves. The hormone cycle in female mice can lead to different behaviors. These changes in behavior could change the results of experiments or tests that scientists conduct.
original_text: Mice have long been a central part of neuroscience research, providing a flexible model that scientists can control and study to learn more about the intricate inner workings of the brain. Historically, researchers have favored male mice over female mice in experiments, in part due to concern that the hormone cycle in females causes behavioral variation that could throw off results.
